item.title: Ticket #652 (Grammar mistake in 'menu.php') updated
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #652 (Grammar mistake in 'menu.php') created
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description:
From wp-admin/menu.php:

if (! user_can_access_admin_page()) {

die( ('You have do not have sufficient permissions to access this page.') );

}

The die() message contains an extra 'have.'

item.title: Ticket #587 (Comments RSS shows latest entry url as itemlink for all items) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
This could be fixed if the following functions could accept arguments:

comment_link_rss($comment_ID) get_comments_link($comment_ID, $post_ID = FALSE)

I've chosen comment IDs instead of post IDs since it seems to me comment_link_rss should reference #comment-IDnumber rather than #comments. get_comments_link could still return #comments if passed a post ID.

item.title: Ticket #646 (Broken Codex link in 'Edit Permalink Structure' section) updated
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description:
What do you mean by " be corrected in WordPress rather than just setting up a redirect " ?

Apologies, I thought I had been explicit enough. I would prefer that the actual hyperlink on the WordPress Admin page be changed to reflect the new Codex page title, rather than simply setting up a redirect in Codex to forward links from the old page title to the new page title. That's why I submitted a diff.

I got the impression that the Codex pages linked-to from WordPress should be prevented from being renamed - which is what has been done.

That is what I meant, mostly -- except that I had pictured changing the link in WordPress and then protecting Using_Permalinks from being moved, but without preventing it from being edited, if it is possible to do so.

edited on: 01-09-05 17:31

item.title: Ticket #649 (Custom 'Options' pages for plugins display duplicate content) updated
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
Owner, Status, Severity changed

Kitten, Is this a plugin-problem?

item.title: Ticket #646 (Broken Codex link in 'Edit Permalink Structure' section) updated
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
According to the bug report you filed, which said: "Description 'number of tags are available' links to ​http://codex.wordpress.org/Permalink_Structure, [] which no longer exists. The page has since been renamed to Using_Permalinks, and the redirect was deleted in maintenance. Additional Information Perhaps those Codex pages that are linked to from within WP should be prevented from being renamed."

I got the impression that the Codex pages linked-to from WordPress should be prevented from being renamed - which is what has been done.

What do you mean by " be corrected in WordPress rather than just setting up a redirect " ?

Please be explicit is stating what the problem is. Problems may not always be resolved in the way expected.

As the codex matures, the links to codex pages from WordPress will get corrected. A number of web-pages linked to from within version 1.2 are no longer linked to -- so things change all the time.

item.title: Ticket #650 (Unable to Edit static pages with external editor) updated
item.dc:creator: dmclark
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #650 (Unable to Edit static pages with external editor) created
item.dc:creator: dmclark
item.description: External editors (like Marsedit) do not have a post_status of static. Though pages show up, editing/saving them viaz xml-rpc causes there status to be changed to published and thus no longer be pages.

item.title: Ticket #649 (Custom 'Options' pages for plugins display duplicate content) updated
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description:
Patch changed
  1. Download and install Kitten's Spaminator ​http://dev.wp-plugins.org/file/spaminator/trunk/kittens-spaminator.php?rev=168&format=txt and/or Geo ​http://dev.wp-plugins.org/file/geo/trunk/geo.php?rev=102&format=txt
  2. Remove the last newline in each to eliminate "Headers already sent" errors, then activate the plugins.
  3. In the Admin panel, click 'Options' from the menu, then 'Geo Info' and/or 'Spaminator' from the submenu

item.title: Ticket #649 (Custom 'Options' pages for plugins display duplicate content) created
item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description:
The 'Options' pages of plugins such as Kitten's Spaminator and Geo (which are the only plugins I know of at the moment that use custom Options pages) display duplicates of:

  • The custom page content generated by the plugin.
  • The custom submenu item for the plugin.

Note that the custom submenu item is only duplicated when a plugin Options page is selected. However, if other plugins are installed, their submenu items are duplicated as well.

item.title: Ticket #637 (Multiple-Page Post doesn't work) closed
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
70:

This is not a bug.

Please use a permalink structure with a "/" between the post id and the page number. The correct urls for the pages 2 and 3 are:

​http://www.le-one.net/wp/index.php/archives/30/2 ​http://www.le-one.net/wp/index.php/archives/30/3

Notice the / between 30 and the page number.

item.title: Ticket #648 (Editing a Link - Escape slashes) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #648 (Editing a Link - Escape slashes) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When editing a link that has either a double or single quote in the link name or description, the escape slashes are placed in the input fields. When submitting, an additional escape slash is inputted, causing the escape slashes to appear on the front page. This will happen an unliminted number of times until you remove all escape slashes from those fields.

item.title: Ticket #647 (staticize_header() non-functional) updated
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Stanley
item.description:
Patch changed

1: Install WP 2: Enable Staticized 3: Function is broken, noted by the conspicuous absense of "X-Staticize" timer... therefore makes contextual MIME setting within that function broken

item.title: Ticket #647 (staticize_header() non-functional) created
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Stanley
item.description:
The header that's supposed to be sent by this function never is, meaning all cached files will only ever be sent with the MIME type "text/html" which is of no use to the anally rententive XHTML crowd/those that use XHTML1.1 properly.

Also, it effected some builds of WP1.3 (IIRC a5), the feeds... as those were caching (1.5 doesn't seem to do this anymore?) and meant their XML-ness with more compliant parsers was completely lost as they too were sent with the incorrect MIME type of "text/html".

item.dc:creator: schultemn
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #645 (Kubrick theme does not display correct rss comment feed link on in ...) created
item.dc:creator: schultemn
item.description:
On line 29 of wp-content/themes/default/single.php we see:

You can follow any responses to this entry through the <a href="<?php bloginfo_rss('comments_rss2_url'); ?>">R SS 2.0</a>

What it should say is:

You can follow any responses to this entry through the <?php comments_rss_link('RSS 2.0'); ?>

item.description: Owner, Status, Resolution changed

item.title: Ticket #249 (Password protected entries don't show comment area) updated
item.dc:creator: schultemn
item.description:
This seems to be related to the kubrick theme; I have the same problem with kubrick (in 1.5 as well) and when I go back to the classic theme the comments are shown with the correct password.

Probably has to do with how the kubrick comments.php is structured?

Somewhere in here, perhaps:

<?php Do not delete these lines

if ('comments.php' == basename($_SERVERSCRIPT_FILENAME?))

die ('Please do not load this page directly. Thanks!');

if (!empty($post->post_password)) { if there's a password

if ($_COOKIE['wp-postpass_'.$cookiehash] != $post->post_password) { and it doesn't match the cookie

?>

item.title: Ticket #644 (No atom enclosures, rss2 empty content) updated
item.dc:creator: Kitten
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #644 (No atom enclosures, rss2 empty content) created
item.dc:creator: Kitten
item.description: The atom feed doesn't include enclosures, and in rss2, if the blog is set to use full text feeds, and the post body is empty, then the feed shows up blank. It should check the body length, and use the excerpt if 0.

item.title: Ticket #640 (Blog URL being added to URLs in post) updated
item.dc:creator: Method55
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #640 (Blog URL being added to URLs in post) created
item.dc:creator: Method55
item.description:
When a URL is posted in a blog entry or comment to a blog entry it is preceded by the URL to the blog.

Example:

The blog posting from is ​http://blog.com

When this is posted in a blog or comment ​http://out.com it ends up in the post as being linked to ​http://blog.com/\http://out.com

If the post or comment is edited this issue goes away.

item.title: Ticket #639 (" / " being placed before " ' " in posts and comments) updated
item.dc:creator: Method55
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #639 (" / " being placed before " ' " in posts and comments) created
item.dc:creator: Method55
item.description: Whenever I post a word containing " ' " such as " It's " or someone comments with the same symbol, when posted it shows up as " It/'s " (the slash is placed in the word for some reason). This happens every time the symbol is used.

item.title: Ticket #638 ("PingBack the URLs in this post" checkbox gone.) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #638 ("PingBack the URLs in this post" checkbox gone.) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
I just noticed this today: The pingback checkbox has been removed.

Why did the pingback checkbox move to a hidden field in edit-form.php v1.29 and edit-form-advanced.php v1.31?

Also, the value of the input is fixed at 1: ​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/view.php?id=329 . Should the value depend on default_pingback_flag?

A hidden field is fine in edit-form.php, but there should be a checkbox in edit-form-advanced.php since "These settings may be overridden for individual articles" (Options -> Discussion).
